code: @Manual{,   title = {anabass: Analyse Basic Structure of Sentences for Better Writing},   author = {Toshikazu Matsumura},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.5.0, https://matutosi.github.io/anabass/},   url = {https://github.com/matutosi/anabass}, }

what: Analyse Basic Structure of Sentences for Better Writing
title: Analyse Basic Structure of Sentences for Better Writing
text: goal anabass analyse basic structure sentences better writeings. anabass name fish ginus anabas. anabas thought climb tree, actual.

title: Analyse Basic Structure of Sentences for Better Writing
text: can install development version GitHub :

title: Analyse Basic Structure of Sentences for Better Writing
text: can use fun() analyse basic structure.
code: library(anabass) #>  #> Attaching package: 'anabass' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stringr': #>  #>     sentences library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  devtools::load_all(".") #> ℹ Loading anabass library(moranajp) review_sentences <-    review_chamame |>   unescape_utf() |>   add_sentence_no() |>   clean_up() |>   dplyr::filter(chap == 5) |>   dplyr::select(sentence, word = "\u539f\u5f62") |>   dplyr::filter(word != "") |>   dplyr::group_by(sentence) |>   dplyr::summarise(word = reduce(word, paste, sep = ";")) |>   `$`(_, "word") |>   stringr::str_split(";")  df <- connect_sentences(review_sentences)  df |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = x_start, y = sentence, label = word)) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   gghighlight::gghighlight(highlight == TRUE, label_key = word) +   ggplot2::scale_y_reverse() +   ggplot2::theme_bw() #> Too many data points, skip labeling df <-    review_chamame |>   unescape_utf() |>   dplyr::filter(chap == 5) |>   add_sentence_no() |>   dplyr::distinct(sect, para, sentence) |>    dplyr::right_join(df) #> Joining with `by = join_by(sentence)`  df |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = x_start, y = sentence, label = word)) +   ggplot2::geom_text() +   ggplot2::scale_y_reverse() +   ggplot2::theme_bw() +    ggplot2::facet_wrap(vars(para))

title: Analyse Basic Structure of Sentences for Better Writing

what: Add Cumulative Character Lengths to a Data Frame Adds a new column x_start and x_end to a data frame, representing the cumulative sum of character lengths within specified groups. — add_x_pos
title: Add Cumulative Character Lengths to a Data Frame Adds a new column x_start and x_end to a data frame, representing the cumulative sum of character lengths within specified groups. — add_x_pos
text: Add Cumulative Character Lengths Data Frame Adds new column x_start x_end data frame, representing cumulative sum character lengths within specified groups. Add index Data Frame Adds new column index data frame, representing cumulative sum character lengths within specified groups.

title: Add Cumulative Character Lengths to a Data Frame Adds a new column x_start and x_end to a data frame, representing the cumulative sum of character lengths within specified groups. — add_x_pos
Add Cumulative Character Lengths to a Data Frame Adds a new column x_start and x_end to a data frame, representing the cumulative sum of character lengths within specified groups. — add_x_pos
text: df data frame containing sentences. group string column name containing sentence identifiers. base string column name containing base words character length calculations.

title: Add Cumulative Character Lengths to a Data Frame Adds a new column x_start and x_end to a data frame, representing the cumulative sum of character lengths within specified groups. — add_x_pos
text: modified data frame added x_start x_end columns. modified data frame added index column.

title: Add Cumulative Character Lengths to a Data Frame Adds a new column x_start and x_end to a data frame, representing the cumulative sum of character lengths within specified groups. — add_x_pos
code: sentences <- list(   c("the", "quick", "brown", "fox"),   c("the", "lazy", "dog"),   c("jumped", "over", "the", "moon") ) df <- list2df(sentences) df <- add_x_pos(df, group = "sentence", base = "word") df <- add_index(df)

Compute the Difference in x Values Between Two Sentences Calculates the difference in x values between two sentences based on the specified connection. — compute_diff_x
text: df data frame containing sentence information. con data frame list representing connection two sentences.

title: Compute the Difference in x Values Between Two Sentences Calculates the difference in x values between two sentences based on the specified connection. — compute_diff_x
text: list containing difference x values index first sentence.

title: Compute the Difference in x Values Between Two Sentences Calculates the difference in x values between two sentences based on the specified connection. — compute_diff_x
code: sentences <- list(   c("there", "is", "a", "quick", "brown", "fox"),   c("the", "fox", "chase", "a", "lazy", "dog"),   c("dog", "jump", "over", "the", "moon"),   c("apple", "apricot", "avocado", "banana") ) df <-   sentences |>   list2df() |>   add_x_pos() |>   add_index()  con <- connect_with(sentences, 1) compute_diff_x(df, con) #> Error in dplyr::filter(df, .data[["sentence"]] == s_i, .data[["index"]] ==     w_i): ℹ In argument: `.data[["sentence"]] == s_i`. #> Caused by error: #> ! 'list' object cannot be coerced to type 'integer'  con <- connect_with(sentences, 2) compute_diff_x(df, con) #> Error in dplyr::filter(df, .data[["sentence"]] == s_i, .data[["index"]] ==     w_i): ℹ In argument: `.data[["sentence"]] == s_i`. #> Caused by error: #> ! 'list' object cannot be coerced to type 'integer'  con <- connect_with(sentences, 3) compute_diff_x(df, con) #> Error in dplyr::filter(df, .data[["sentence"]] == s_i, .data[["index"]] ==     w_i): ℹ In argument: `.data[["sentence"]] == s_i`. #> Caused by error: #> ! 'list' object cannot be coerced to type 'integer'  con <- connect_with(sentences, 4) compute_diff_x(df, con) #> Error in dplyr::filter(df, .data[["sentence"]] == s_i, .data[["index"]] ==     w_i): ℹ In argument: `.data[["sentence"]] == s_i`. #> Caused by error: #> ! 'list' object cannot be coerced to type 'integer'

title: Find the First Connection for a Given Sentence Finds the first connection for a given sentence in a list of sentences. — connect_with

title: Find the First Connection for a Given Sentence Finds the first connection for a given sentence in a list of sentences. — connect_with
code: sentences <- list(   c("there", "is", "a", "quick", "brown", "fox"),   c("the", "fox", "chase", "a", "lazy", "dog"),   c("dog", "jump", "over", "the", "moon") ) connect_with(sentences, 1) #> $sentence_i #> $sentence_i[[1]] #> [1] "there" "is"    "a"     "quick" "brown" "fox"   #>  #> $sentence_i[[2]] #> [1] "the"   "fox"   "chase" "a"     "lazy"  "dog"   #>  #> $sentence_i[[3]] #> [1] "dog"  "jump" "over" "the"  "moon" #>  #>  connect_with(sentences, 2) #> $sentence_i #> $sentence_i[[1]] #> [1] "there" "is"    "a"     "quick" "brown" "fox"   #>  #> $sentence_i[[2]] #> [1] "the"   "fox"   "chase" "a"     "lazy"  "dog"   #>  #> $sentence_i[[3]] #> [1] "dog"  "jump" "over" "the"  "moon" #>  #>  connect_with(sentences, 3) #> $sentence_i #> $sentence_i[[1]] #> [1] "there" "is"    "a"     "quick" "brown" "fox"   #>  #> $sentence_i[[2]] #> [1] "the"   "fox"   "chase" "a"     "lazy"  "dog"   #>  #> $sentence_i[[3]] #> [1] "dog"  "jump" "over" "the"  "moon" #>  #>

title: Convert List of Sentences to Data Frame Converts a list of character vectors (sentences) into a data frame with two columns: word and sentence. — list2df
code: sentences <- list(   c("the", "quick", "brown", "fox"),   c("the", "lazy", "dog"),   c("jumped", "over", "the", "moon") ) list2df(sentences) #> # A tibble: 11 × 2 #>    word   sentence #>    <chr>     <int> #>  1 the           1 #>  2 quick         1 #>  3 brown         1 #>  4 fox           1 #>  5 the           2 #>  6 lazy          2 #>  7 dog           2 #>  8 jumped        3 #>  9 over          3 #> 10 the           3 #> 11 moon          3

code: sentences <- list(   c("the", "quick", "brown", "fox"),   c("the", "lazy", "dog"),   c("jumped", "over", "the", "moon") ) list2df(sentences) |>   split_sentence() #> <list_of< #>   tbl_df< #>     word    : character #>     sentence: integer #>   > #> >[3]> #> [[1]] #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   word  sentence #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 the          1 #> 2 quick        1 #> 3 brown        1 #> 4 fox          1 #>  #> [[2]] #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   word  sentence #>   <chr>    <int> #> 1 the          2 #> 2 lazy         2 #> 3 dog          2 #>  #> [[3]] #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   word   sentence #>   <chr>     <int> #> 1 jumped        3 #> 2 over          3 #> 3 the           3 #> 4 moon          3 #>

what: Update x Positions Based on a Computed Difference Updates the x_start and x_end positions in a data frame based on a computed difference. — update_x_pos
title: Update x Positions Based on a Computed Difference Updates the x_start and x_end positions in a data frame based on a computed difference. — update_x_pos
text: Update x Positions Based Computed Difference Updates x_start x_end positions data frame based computed difference.

title: Update x Positions Based on a Computed Difference Updates the x_start and x_end positions in a data frame based on a computed difference. — update_x_pos
Update x Positions Based on a Computed Difference Updates the x_start and x_end positions in a data frame based on a computed difference. — update_x_pos
text: df data frame containing sentence information. diff list representing difference x values index first sentence.

title: Update x Positions Based on a Computed Difference Updates the x_start and x_end positions in a data frame based on a computed difference. — update_x_pos
text: modified data frame updated x_start x_end positions.

title: Update x Positions Based on a Computed Difference Updates the x_start and x_end positions in a data frame based on a computed difference. — update_x_pos
code: sentences <- list(   c("there", "is", "a", "quick", "brown", "fox"),   c("the", "fox", "chase", "a", "lazy", "dog"),   c("dog", "jump", "over", "the", "moon"),   c("apple", "apricot", "avocado", "banana") ) df <-   sentences |>   list2df() |>   add_x_pos() |>   add_index()  for(i in seq_along(sentences)){   con <- connect_with(sentences, i)  # if(is.null(con$sentence_j)) next   diff <- compute_diff_x(df, con)   df <- update_x_pos(df, diff) } #> Error in dplyr::filter(df, .data[["sentence"]] == s_i, .data[["index"]] ==     w_i): ℹ In argument: `.data[["sentence"]] == s_i`. #> Caused by error: #> ! 'list' object cannot be coerced to type 'integer' print(df, n = Inf) #> # A tibble: 21 × 5 #>    sentence word    x_start x_end index #>       <int> <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <int> #>  1        1 there       0     5       1 #>  2        1 is          5     7.3     2 #>  3        1 a           7.3   8.7     3 #>  4        1 quick       8.7  13.7     4 #>  5        1 brown      13.7  18.7     5 #>  6        1 fox        18.7  21.9     6 #>  7        2 the         0     3.2     1 #>  8        2 fox         3.2   6.4     2 #>  9        2 chase       6.4  11.4     3 #> 10        2 a          11.4  12.8     4 #> 11        2 lazy       12.8  16.9     5 #> 12        2 dog        16.9  20.1     6 #> 13        3 dog         0     3.2     1 #> 14        3 jump        3.2   7.3     2 #> 15        3 over        7.3  11.4     3 #> 16        3 the        11.4  14.6     4 #> 17        3 moon       14.6  18.7     5 #> 18        4 apple       0     5       1 #> 19        4 apricot     5    11.8     2 #> 20        4 avocado    11.8  18.6     3 #> 21        4 banana     18.6  24.5     4  df |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = x_start, y = sentence, label = word)) +   ggplot2::geom_text() +   ggplot2::scale_y_reverse() +   ggplot2::theme_bw()
